Media Querys¶

Simple media query shorthands. The mixin bp is the one you will use most. Screen sizes can be configured via the $screensizes variable in blue leaf Core.

SASS¶

@mixin bp($screen:s,$mode:up) { @content }

The most important mixin. Define rules dependent on $screen. $mode indicates whether bigger/smaller screen sizes should be included or not.

$screen

See the $screensizes variable in blue leaf Core. Normally s, m or l.

$mode

up, down or onl.

@mixin bp-o($orientation) { @content }

Respond to device orientation.

$orientation

landscape or portrait.

The following functions are used to construct advanced media querys. They can be used like this:

@media #{bpBase() and mediaQueryScreen("m","up")}, #{bpBase() and bpOrientation("portrait")} {
    some: code;
}
@function bpBase()

Makes sure that styles are applied to screens only.

@function bpScreen($screen,$mode)

Respond to screen sizes.

$screen

See the $screensizes variable in blue leaf Core. Normally s, m or l.

$mode

up, down or onl.

@function bpOrientation($orientation)

Respond to orientation.

$orientation

landscape or portrait.
